summary: This bill, the LEASH DOGE Act, mandates the head of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to provide Congress with detailed information on its employees and activities. This includes a report to Congress, appearances at closed committee meetings, and the establishment and operation of a public website. The website will provide information to the public about DOGE employees, funding changes, and contact information. The bill also defines DOGE employees and sets deadlines for compliance, with restrictions on the use of funds if the head of DOGE fails to meet the requirements.
